intro: Tapura cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban tapura, is a rare flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in coastal forests. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
